channel.title: DMCA From JaGeX
channel.description: Okay, i just got a DMCA from JaGeX and i had to shut down my server because i don't want to get in trouble with the law. I'm not in the USA/UK but i didn't know what to do. What should i have done?

item.title: DMCA From JaGeX
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

Mopar, I’m guessing most web host are aware of fake DMCAs?

Read full topic

item.title: DMCA From JaGeX
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“tobias222, post:37, topic:338978”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=435362.msg3198343#msg3198343 date=1273022665]
You guys do realize that ANYONE can send emails from whatever address they want very easily correct? copyright@jagex.com, president@whitehouse.gov etc etc. The only way to know if someone actually owns an email is if you reply to them, and then they reply back.
[/quote]

True. But some people send an email pretending to be jagex and warn them to take down the server within the next two days or they will take legal action etc… or tell them to reply to a ‘temp’ email or something… :S[/quote]

You just need to reply to them and if they quote you and send you another reply, you know it is legitimate. Otherwise you don’t.

Read full topic

item.title: DMCA From JaGeX
item.dc:creator: @vovchik30 vovchik30
item.description:
@vovchik30 wrote:

tobias222:

When it comes down to when you get a real legit DMCA, there is not much you can do, I would keep your client files on a different computer than your server files, and upload your cache to multiple hosts if you have auto cache downloading to save time.

just buy a mmeory stick i have a psp and have a 2mb memory card for my server and 8mb memory card for my psp stuff so just put the memorystick in and code from there so u can easily take it out when your gonig on a trip if u have a laptop and ur files arent on there u just put hte memory card in its that easy just take it out when needed plus when ur pc crashes i dont think it wil effect ur pc unles its a type of virus that could do it but all u should have an antivirus and if u download a new client make sure u read wat it says first because it could says some thing like del C:/windows32/ or something like that so it wil crash ur pc and the costs wil be up to 50-100 dollarsso just watch out cuz it could also be a virus website openingup instead of the servers website

P.S my house got robed so they took my psp and the memory sticks good thing they didnt steal the pc i had my files on there but the most safe way is upload on a wwebsite and keep it private and updated everytime so when u do get robed u wont be coding from skratch because he forgot to update what u have done over the time

Read full topic

item.title: DMCA From JaGeX
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

Be careful, My hosting company used to have fake DMCAs sent from some sad bastard… and its not hard to do

When it comes down to when you get a real legit DMCA, there is not much you can do, I would keep your client files on a different computer than your server files, and upload your cache to multiple hosts if you have auto cache downloading to save time.

Explain plainly in the email you did not upload the client, and you cannot be responsible for people uploading it and sharing the link, (even better if you have a server that works with more than one client base), or just say you have never modified a rs2 client, and your server can just be any java server with a packet structure similar to the rs server to enable you to log on? I would also put a disclaimer on your website. I have also heard it helps somewhat if you have no financial benefit from your server… Just what people are saying to me…

Read full topic

item.title: DMCA From JaGeX
item.dc:creator: @faded_vision Faded Vision
item.description:
@faded_vision wrote:

They sent out DMCA’s to every servers that takes there attention, they don’t have the legal resources or power to prove its you and they would also need to track you down and take you to court. This simply would not happen, all the big servers have received several of these and continue to do so.

Its Jagex’s way of scaring 1/10 server owners into packing there bags.

They send out 100s of these a day.

Read full topic

item.title: DMCA From JaGeX
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“zuppers, post:20, topic:338978”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=435362.msg3197577#msg3197577 date=1272940421]
Tell them to fuck off, the server was not programed by them so why should you take it down? They can get you to take there client down, but keep that server running because you’re not breaking any fucking law.
[/quote]Even if the server wasn’t programed by them, they own the game protocol, which the server uses.[/quote]

They may own it, but Ive never seen them use it to take a server down?

item.title: DMCA From JaGeX
item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:4, topic:338978”]Ok this is all you have to do, add Blake’s RSBuffer and crash patch to your server, Jagex can send all the messages they want but your sever will be 100% programmed by non-Jagex members meaning it breaks no copyright laws. As for your client, don’t host anything client related stuff on your VPS or what ever you have, just have a link to download it from mediafire or uppit.[/quote]Cool then they can take it off of mediafire and uppit and sue for the distribution of a modified version of their client. And even if you added “RSBuffer and crash-patched it” as long as you agreed to the TOS you are breaking their TOS which they can sue for.

Read full topic
